com.ethercis.servicemanager.service

Interface I_Service

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    I_Manager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClusterInfo, DummyConsumer, DummyProvider, DummyService, DummyService2

    public interface I_Service

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getType() 
      java.lang.String getVersion() 
      void init(ClusterController glob, ServiceInfo serviceInfo)
      This method is called by the ServiceManager.

      Cleans up the resource.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(ClusterController glob,
          ServiceInfo serviceInfo)
   throws ServiceManagerException
        This method is called by the ServiceManager.

        Example how options are evaluated: 

           // An entry in services.properties (in one line):
   MimeSubscribeService[ContentLenFilter][1.0]=\
                 com.privantis.mime.demo.ContentLenFilter,\
                 DEFAULT_MAX_LEN=200,DEFAULT_MIN_LEN=20

  // Access it like this:
  java.common.Properties props = serviceInfo.getParameters();
  String maxLen = (String)props.get("DEFAULT_MAX_LEN");
  String throwLen = (String)props.get("THROW_EXCEPTION_FOR_LEN");
        Parameters:
        ClusterController - An ehrserver instance global object holding logging and property informations
        ServiceInfo - A container holding informations about the service, e.g. its parameters
        Throws:
        ServiceManagerException

      • getType

        java.lang.String getType()

      • getVersion

        java.lang.String getVersion()

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
       throws ServiceManagerException
        Cleans up the resource.
        Throws:
        ServiceManagerException - if an exception occurs. The exception is handled by the RunLevelManager depending on how the service has been configured with the action:

        <action do='STOP' onShutdownRunlevel='2' sequence='5' onFail='resource.configuration.serviceFailed'> If onFail is defined to something, the RunLevelManager will stop.
